references.paper_title: BERT: Pre-training of deep bidirectional transformers for language understanding
references.reason: This paper introduces BERT, a foundational transformer model leveraged extensively in the current work for word sense disambiguation and related tasks.

references.paper_title: Word sense disambiguation: A unified evaluation framework and empirical comparison
references.reason: This paper provides the standard benchmark framework for word sense disambiguation (WSD) that is used and extended in this study for evaluating the proposed Word Sense Linking (WSL) task.

references.paper_title: Breaking through the 80% glass ceiling: Raising the state of the art in word sense disambiguation by incorporating knowledge graph information
references.reason: This paper represents state-of-the-art results in WSD using knowledge graphs, providing a strong comparison point for the proposed WSL methods.

references.paper_title: ConSeC: Word sense disambiguation as continuous sense comprehension
references.reason: This paper presents a highly competitive WSD model that is thoroughly compared against the new WSL approach, offering a strong baseline for performance evaluation.

references.paper_title: Dense passage retrieval for open-domain question answering
references.reason: This paper introduces the retriever-reader paradigm, the core architecture used in the proposed WSL model for efficiently identifying candidate senses and disambiguating spans.
